intro: Scabiosa zuikoensis, commonly known as the Japanese scabious, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy and upright. Scabiosa zuikoensis is valued in gardens for its ornamental flowers and ecological benefits to pollinators.
